item.title: Report E-2024070658
item.description:
Report E-2024070658

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-30
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ADVANTAGE MANAGEMENT GROUP, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 16020
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was attempting to position the unit at the customer site in order to complete his delivery. The KAG Energy, LLC unit struck a pole and caused damage to the loading/unloading lines on the trailer. Approximately 7 gallons of gasoline was released. Clean Harbors Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Zep Industrial purple cleaner and degreaser package was improperly packed and shipped with no inner packing causing contents to be vulnerable to damage due to package being dropped and causing liquid to leak out from one gallon jug. Packaging got ripped and started to disintegrate from corrosive liquid.

item.title: Report X-2024071894
item.description:
Report X-2024071894

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: REDMOND
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This was found while loading a delivery truck. It was brought to repacks. It was put into a plastic hazmat bag and hazmat drum and brought to the hazmat cage and put under the vent. The area where the liquid came out was not apparent. The cap was tight, and it didn't leak from there. The spill was at the bottom of the shipping box, and you can see the ring from the bottom of the container. But no apparent seam split or hole. There was an indent in the container, but it was toward the top of the container. But there was liquid in the plastic bag that the container was in with a zip tie.

item.title: Report X-2024071951
item.description:
Report X-2024071951

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE BROWN BELT A LOADER APPROACHED AND TOLD RESPONDER HE HAD A HAZMAT LEAKER. THE PACKAGE HAD BEEN LOADED ON TO THE SHELF AND A SMALL PUDDLE WAS NOTICABLE BEHIND IT. RECOGNIZING THE CLASS 3 DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL RESPONDER CHECKED THE DECISION TREE, AND WEARING PROPER PPE, CONTAINED THE PACKAGE. AFTER WIPING UP THE SPILL RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
